1.content:
Welcome! To the worlds of sci-fi, fantasy and fat girls! It’s going to be Fairy fun…come on, that was pretty punny…I’m so sorry.

Fantasy stories- Magic, monsters and mayhem, what else could you want? ...Oh right...fat women...

First are the Castle Gain stories, featuring a pretty princess and a powerful prince, two sexy servants, a noble knight, a feisty farm girl, the wonderful witch, the wacky wizard and more.

This is Normal (Non-specific fattening)- Undead hordes and creatures of darkness working for the wizard-gone-Lich, as well as unstable relations with their neighboring countries are a constant threat to the Human Kingdom, but that’s the way it’s been for decades, maybe something new is due to happen.

Plumped up for Peace- In order to preserve peace between the Humans and the Amazons, all women of age in the Human kingdom must grow.

Misfired Fattening- After a hundred years of planning, the Lich Ekafeman has perfected a spell that will allow it to take over the world, but even when the spell goes wrong, it still thinks its plan can work.

The Elf-Queen Human- The daughter of the Human prince has married the successor to the Forest Kingdom, this is not only the first time a royal has married outside their kingdom’s races, but also the first time they’ve been the same sex.

Next, we have the Fantasy Fattening stories, where women from across the world will gain.

The Fattening Elements- Six wandering mages have become the most powerful guild in the land, now if only they weren’t wandering they’d be set.

Goddess Fatten it- Weight gain of divine proportions happens here.

Halfling Club- A Halfling Fairy goes to her two closet friends for help finding her partner, too bad they aren’t on the best terms.

Shame on Fame- Being a famous adventuress isn’t all it’s cracked up to be, maybe it’s time for a little break.

Sci-fi stories- Whether they take place in the distant future or a closer time, on distant worlds across the galaxy, a planet just next door or in a entirely different universe, sci-fi stories of all kinds are welcome here.

First for sci-fi are the Silent Gain stories that take place aboard the Silent Sword, a starship owned by a psychopathic professor and piloted by a pair of twins, there is also the professor’s assistant, a rouge super soldier, a chef, their resident alien and the Valentine family.

Just Doing Our Job (Non-specific fattening)- The crew of Silent Sword go from planet to planet, doing job request, research, or just relaxing, though most of the time they are aboard the ship while they wait to arrive at their next destination.

Gaining Gadget- After arresting a man who’s been using a device to influence people into having sex with him, the device starts to influence the Silent Swords crew to do something else.

Stranded and Stuffed- When the Silent Sword crash lands on an unknown planet, the female crewmembers find themselves being fattened by its inhabitants.

Crossed- A giant metal dragon spewing fire and lightening is heading straight for a mid-evil castle.

Lastly, we have multiple stories of sci-fi women from all across the Milky Way!

Cosmic Corpulence- The only band in the galaxy that is home to only a single sentient species is the Orion Band, home of the Humans. Fifty percent of all the Human colonies exist inside of it, and after the first contact war ended, the entire Human Empire was once again able to use them to their advantage.

Galaxy’s most fattened- The most wanted, and most dangerous life form in the known galaxies, is a pirate that commands a ship the size of a city, and employs a crew of over four hundred thousand. But after their latest plunder, their pockets won't be the only thing getting fatter.

Weighty Walkers (Edit)- A time traveler and his friends have been on amazing adventures though all the universe and its history, but when things start to get a little lax, it starts to have an affect on the figures of his female friends.

Expanding Earth- The planet is expanding! Well, not the planet, more like the things that live on it-er, more specifically the females...even more specifically, human females.

OH! Almost forgot, there is also a category for stories that could be considered both genres, as well as ones that aren't really either but still feel like they belong there.
1.title: Back or to the futue? ...Expect a few of these.

11.content:
The world of Ger is separated into four continents, the largest of them all is known as Honger, and the second largest country is known as Gainger, at its center is the capital castle city, Castle Gaingerguard, or Castle Gain for short. The kingdom is ruled by the Gaingerguard family, the two curetnt leaders being Prince Bradley and Princess Fiona Gaingerguard.

Bradley is the younger sibling but is much wiser and more responsible one, though if you insult his appearance he’ll snap, especially his long hair that is always in a ponytail, or his all purple wardrobe, while Fiona's mood is almost always cheery, and she can sometimes even be a little childish. Bradley will also get over protective of his adopted daughter Amelia, who coincidentally has the same black hair as him and Fiona, as well as the same blue eyes, unlike Fiona's green ones. Along with being caring for his daughter, Bradley is also caring for his kingdom and fights alongside his trusted knights when needed, with weapons along with royal magic, and while he is adept in both fields, Fiona's magic far outshines Bradley's, and more than makes up for her lacking in combat skills.

All of Bradley's and Fiona's needs are taken care of by the royal servants and sisters, Jennifer and Rebecca. Jessica and Rebecca both have blond hair, but Jennifer has brown eyes and Rebbecca has blue, just like her prince's. Both servants are close to their respective royal, but each in different ways. Jennifer is very nervous, cautious and basically joined to Fiona at the hip, while Rebbecca is more independent and curious, and her relationship with Bradley has become one of very close friends, he even calls her Becky to be more friendly, and is even a little less "prince-y", as she likes to call it, when he is around her. They are so close, that it is rumored that they are having an affair, and another one says that Fiona and Jennifer are in love with each other, and are too afraid to tell the other of their feelings, but neither of those are right.

Their is another familiar pair of siblings known around the castle, the farm girl Shirley, and her twin brother the great knight Sir Lee. Shirley lives on the farm in one of the lower levels of the city, while Sir Lee lives in the castle barracks, and it's good that they live so far away, as they don't get along at all. Shirley hate's that he left her all alone on the, even though she has several farmhands that work for her, and that eventually they stopped speaking to each other, not that Sir Lee was very social to begin with. In fact, no one even knows or remembers what he looks like, as he always wears his full plate armor every where he goes, and Shirley hasn't seen him in years. Though, since they're twins, they probably look somewhat alike and have the same green eyes and brown hair.

Lastly, in the castle tower lives the grand wizard...Wizard, and his (great, great, great, great, great) granddaughter, the witch Crystal, who has a massive crush on Sir Lee, even though she's never seen what he looks like. Crystal isn't one of those wrinkly old hag witches with green skin and a big nose; instead she is a beautiful young woman with smooth skin, that's rather pale from spending so much time in her tower, black hair, hazel eyes, and a youthful body with a large pot belly, or “cauldron” belly as she prefers to call it.

This is Normal (Non-specific fattening)- Undead hordes and creatures of darkness working for the wizard-gone-Lich, as well as unstable relations with their neighboring countries are a constant threat to the Human Kingdom, but that’s the way it’s been for decades, maybe something new is due to happen.

Plumped up for Peace- In order to preserve peace between the Humans and the Amazons, all women of age in the Human kingdom must grow.

Misfired Fattening- After a hundred years of planning, the Lich Ekafeman has perfected a spell that will allow it to take over the world, but even when the spell goes wrong, it still thinks its plan can work.

The Elf-Queen Human- Amelia is all grown up and is getting married to a long time friend, and while her friends, family and kingdom are supportive, her soon-to-be-in-laws might not.

The next day Wizard disappears (again) leaving Crystal in charge of the tower...
A week later those new crops come in! Where do you get plants that grow so fast?
111.content:
After moving one final pillow into place, Jessica had finished cleaning and organizing Princess Fiona’s chambers, along with some minor redecorating. She than fussed with her skirt for a moment before she sat down on Fiona’s freshly made bed, and stared out a window at the moon in the star filled sky, waiting for her friend to return. Though, Jessica didn’t have to wait very long before the door to the room opened and the Princess-in-pink stormed into the room. “I take it that the date did not go well?” She asked as her eager smile changed into a disappointed frown.

“Do they ever?! Goddesses, what is wrong with me?!” Fiona yelled taking a seat on the bed beside Jessica as her eyes began to water.

As much as she hated to admit it, Jessica predicted this would be the outcome of Fiona’s date with tonight’s suitor. After all Fiona was right, they didn’t ever go well. No one knew why, but the Princess was never able to connect with any of them, the whole experience just felt wrong to her. And though the suitors never paid it any mind, Fiona did.

Bringing a new, comforting smile to her face, Jessica wrapped one arm around Fiona’s shoulders to pull he closer, and the wrapped her other arm around her waist, determined to make her royal friend feel better, no matter what. “Milady, there is nothing wrong with you! It is not your fault! Just because you don’t feel anything for these men doesn’t mean something is wrong with you, it just means they aren’t right for you. And if you were to line up a million women who aren’t right for those men, they’d feel the same as you do now, and just like you they would be wrong. So I assure you that you are as normal as a person can be, and there is nothing wrong with waiting for someone who can make you feel whatever the others can’t.” She said in a successful attempt to calm her Princess down.

“Thank you, Jessica; I don’t even know what came over me.”

“I’m sure it’s just stress, Princess. It can get to the best of us if we aren’t careful.”

Meanwhile, down in the castle sparing grounds, Prince Bradley and Sir Lee were engaged in combat and had been since early in that morning. When it started they had many spectators, it wasn’t often that the two most powerful warriors dueled after all, but now it had boiled down to Lady Amelia and Rebecca cheering for Bradley, and the witch Crystal cheering for Lee.

“Are you…ready to…call it…a draw?” Bradley offered while huffing a puffing from exhaustion, still tying to maintain his shaky fighting stance with his great sword becoming too heavy for him to hold up.

“I’d say…that sounds…reasonable.” While Bradley had very little armor and had to fight with a defensive style, Lee had leather armor layered over by chain mail layered over by scale mail and then covered by full plate armor and could fight without fear of anything but his armor being harmed, and in this case, it was very harmed. It was amazing the he never tired out from lugging around all that armor all hours of the day every day. In fact, no one had ever seen him out of armor since the day he arrived for training to be a night when he was ten and it seems like the only one who knows what he looks like is his sister. But despite never seeing an inch of his skin, that didn’t stop Crystal from falling madly in love with him.

“C’mon Lee, don’t give up, kick his royal butt!” She yelled while floating in the sky above the arena, but being carful that no one could see up her black skirt…well, maybe she angled herself at Lee once or twice or twelve.

Rebecca rolled her eyes at the witch. “Don’t encourage them they’ll start all over again!” She called out from the stands.

“Yeah, it’s already too late for a bedtime story; I don’t want to have to tuck myself in either!” Amelia said in agreement.

Lee nodded his head as he sheathed his weapon, causing a peace of armor broke off and fall to the ground. “…I will need to repair my armor before I can risk another round with his majesty; I was rather surprised at his endurance, speed and over all power.”

“I can say the same of you; it’s not often that a single opponent can tire me so quickly.” Bradley admitted as he too sheathed his weapon.

“So-uh, Lee…do you need any help repairing your armor? Maybe you could take it all off and have a rest in my chambers while I go at it with my-“

“Why’d you cover my ears?” Asked Amelia, looking up at Rebecca who had her hands clamped firmly over the young girls ears. Rebecca looked down at Amelia and began to say something, but nothing got through. “Can we go now I’m getting cold?”

Rebecca nodded her head and moved her hands away. “Of course Lady Amelia, go inside and I’ll make sure your father will be there soon to tuck you in.”

“Okay, night-y night Auntie Becky,”

After being turned down by Lee to…”polish his thrusting rapier”, Crystal floated off to see her friend Shirley, who she used as a sounding board for her problems with Lee, and since she was his brother it worked out even better for her since Shirley could tell her more about Lee. Sure, sometimes Crystal had to work on her far to pay her back, but it wasn’t all that hard thanks to her magic. While Lee himself returned to his barracks.

“Welcome back, boss. Did you find what you were looking for?” One of Shirley’s farmhands asked as she came through the fields with a burlap sack slung over her shoulder.

“Sure did.” Shirley let the bag drop, causing purple seeds to spill out. “Start planting those as soon as possible, they might grow fast but if they don’t get some water soon they’ll be useless.”

“Right away boss,” The farmhand then bent over, took the sack and went off deeper into the fields.

Shirley smiled and began to walk back to her ranch house. She couldn’t wait to get inside, was up, and take a long rest after a longer day. Plus, with the knowledge that those miracle plants would soon come in and save her farm from going under, she had nothing to worry about tonight. That is, she didn’t until she saw her witchy “friend” flying towards her; and a little faster than normal.

Before Shirley had a chance to get out of the way, Crystal had slammed into her, knocking them both to the ground, with Crystal laying top of Shirley. “Woops, sorry, didn’t mean for that to happen.”

“I SAW YOU TURN!!! Now get off of me, you weigh more than my some of my pigs you cow!” Shirley yelled as she tried to wriggle her way out from under the weighty witch.

Crystal giggled and then floated up off of her flattened farm girl friend. “Well, which is it? Am I a cow or a sow?”

“Both,” Shirley deadpanned while she got up out of the dirt. “Now what do you want, as if I didn’t already know.” Crystal smiled and went over her entire day, one that Shirley could tell was a long one very early in, so she decided to walk while Crystal talked and by the time she finished, they had finally made inside the house. “Well, it’s nice to hear that Lee can still waist his whole day on something stupid while I’m working my ass off.” Shirley said with a mix of sarcasm and anger as she and Crystal went inside her home.

Crystal pouted at Shirley. “He does a lot of productive stuff, too! Besides, I heard that you’ve been gone for like, two weeks!”

“I was looking for a crop that could save my farm, which I wouldn’t even need to do if Lee was here to help me!” Crystal sighed and took a seat to prepare for the impending rant that Shirley was about to go on. “I mean, do you think I wanted to run the farm? NO! I had my own dream, but because of him I can never live it since I have to keep this place from going under leaving me with no time to pursue it! Plus I…and…whatever, what do you want anyway!”

Surprised that the rant ended so soon Crystal asked her question, “Do you two look alike?”

“What?”

“I mean…you’re twins right, and twins usually look alike, right?”

“Uh, we used to, but it’s been over a decade since I’ve seen him so I doubt he dose any more, and if he dose that makes him a very pretty man.”

“Or makes you a very ugly woman…”

“…I’m going to bed. You can stay if you want, just don’t eat all my food!"
111.title: This is Normal?!

choices: Fiona and Jessica have their day in the market.
Shirley and Crystal get in a fight about Sir Lee.
Bradley and Rebecca playfully poke fun at each other.
1111.content:
Amelia shot up in fear. The castle was under attack by the undead! She could hear them moaning in the room next to hers through a crack in the wall. Yet it seemed no one else noticed the invasion, as the alarm had not been sounded! That meant only one thing. It was up to her to fight the monsters! She hopped out of bed quietly and made her way over to her toy box. She opened it and began to fish around for something. When she found them, she equipped herself with them quickly. On her head was a metal pail she had turned into a knight’s helmet. Draped over her torso was a piece of leather from a horse’s saddle and would serve as her body armor, and lastly she griped a wooden sword in her right hand.

After swallowing hard in an attempt to replace her fear with courage, Amelia stepped outside her room and looked down the torch lit hall. She saw no danger so she stepped out and made the short walk to the room next to hers. She pressed her ear against the door to try and hear more clearly, and she definitely heard moaning. Amelia raised her left hand shakily to the door knob, and when she had a firm grasp on it, she opened the door, charged inside without fear and yelled, “I’ll save you Auntie Fiona!”

Everyone in the room froze. There were no monsters, no undead horde, just Amelia, Fiona, and Jessica; the latter two in the same bed, with Jessica on top of Fiona.

With her face flushed a deep red, Jessica slowly moved off her Princess’s back, allowing Fiona sit up as well. “L-Lady Amelia, w-what are you doing up so late?” Jessica asked nervously.

“I heard moaning through my wall and it woke me up! I thought there were monsters in here, but it looks like you were attacking my Auntie!” Amelia shouted with her toy sword aimed at Jessica.

“N-no, that’s not what I was doing! The Princess has been very stressed as of late, I was merely giving her a massage to help her relax!”

Amelia looked to Fiona for some kind of confirmation to Jessica’s story, to which she got a frantic nod, and Amelia lowered her “weapon” to her side and look at them as though she was unsure. “Alright, if you say so, I’m going to go back to bed, then. Try to keep it down.” She then turned back to the door and left Fiona’s room.

When she was gone, Fiona let out a sigh of relief. “I have to admit, I was a little worried there.”

“Why, I was only giving you a massage, Milady…” Jessica pointed out, though it sounded as if she was unsure about it herself.

“R-right, I mean, I’m still have my dress,” Fiona paused to gesture at the pink frills of her evening gown. “But Amelia might have seen it another way.”

“And…what way would that be?” She had a good idea, but once again she wasn’t too sure, and wanted to hear it to make sure.

“I mean in a…” Fiona’s face went flush as she tried to explain. “…sensual or…intimate way…however absurd that may be.”

Jessica blushed back at Fiona. “R-right, absolutely absurd…”

“Yes…p-perhaps you should return to your own room now, Jessica. We’ve both had a long day and should get some sleep.”

“As you wish, Milady,” Jessica gave a curtsy to Fiona before turning to the door, but before she left she turned back and asked, “Will we still be going to the market tomorrow?”

Fiona smiled and nodded. “Of course; now get out of my room and go to sleep.” Fiona joked with mock seriousness, but Jessica left swiftly after, probably thinking that she was serious.

With Jessica gone, Fiona got up and began to strip down so she could change into her sleepwear. Another blush came to her face when she was fully unclothed. Her dress and her underwear were neatly folded on her bed, including her girdle.

Yes, over the past few weeks, Fiona had found the need to use a girdle to hid her new found gut. It was nowhere near the size of Crystal’s, but it was still big enough that Fiona felt that she should try her best to minimize its size, and the girdle did just that. Her new fleshy belly was invisible to the world when she wore it. Though, it was incredibly uncomfortable to wear, and she was glad to be out of it for the night.

Quickly placing her old clothes into aside on a dresser, Fiona then dressed herself for bed, and got into bed. She closed her eyes and let her mind wander to the events of the next day. Fiona imagined herself meeting Jessica outside the stables, talking a bit before mounting her horse and taking her on a nice relaxing ride into the market, where they would go shopping for anything they might need or that would catch their eyes. Then, they’d find a nice place to eat before attending a show or two. After the shows, they mounted her horse once again and return to the castle with full bags and an empty purse, at which point she would need to start preparing for a date with yet another suitor, where they’d sit at opposite ends of an impossibly long table, and talk about something dreadfully boring while eating some disgusting meal from his homeland, and ending several hours later in failure. ‘At least the first part of the day will be good.” Fiona thought as she drifted of to herself as she slowly drifted off.

112.content:
Prince Bradley Gaingerguard and the great knight Sir Lee led the forces of humanity against the invading Amazons, a near-human species that had a fighting force made entirely of females. In appearance, they were nearly identical, except being slightly taller and physically stronger than most humans. The humans outclassed the Amazons in terms of magic, but the Amazon's advantage was in their numbers and rigid military structure. Bradley and the knights fought hard, but had to surrender in the end, which began the negotiations for peace. the prince and princess met with Queen Zephoia of the Amazons. Zephoia would return all of humanity's land on one condition: every human female above the age of eighteen must gain weight and meet a monthly requirement of pounds gained. Fiona and Bradley had no choice but to accept, for if they refused, the Amazons would drive humanity to the brink of extinction. Fiona was sixteen then, meaning that she'd have two years of thinness left before she would have to expand.

2 years later,

Fiona dressed in a black dress, for a woman's eighteenth birthday was no longer a happy occasion in the human kingdom. She looked at her thin body one last time before heading to her birthday dinner with Prince Bradley, who had a hardened stoic look about him. He had never forgiven himself for allowing this travesty to occur in his kingdom and hadn't made a public appearance in over a year. His hair was down to his shoulders and he had stubble on his face. He was even more unhappy that Queen Zephoia and her elite guard had decided to join them for dinner in order to "celebrate" Fiona's new lifestyle. The Amazons had a goal of humiliating the humans and they had done just that.

The Amazons expected that the princess of the human kingdom would serve as an example for the rest of their female population, and if the terms of the treaty were to be kept, she would. Her birthday "celebration" lasted exactly seven days. That meant seven days of feasting for women, especially Fiona. On the eighth day, the Amazons weighed her with their advanced scale technology, a device that's able to measure a person's weight just by standing on it.

On the day of the weighing, Fiona was more nervous than she had ever been in her life. She was wearing nothing but her bra and panties, which allowed her belly, however somewhat small, to stick out to its fullest capacity. Additionally, her boobs and butt protruded quite far from the base of her figure. Bradley and little Amelia stood backstage with her, comforting her and telling her that she was going to be fine. The weighing was at a platform in front of the royal residence and all of the townspeople were required to attend, a rule that was enforced by the Amazon elites. Queen Zephoia was absent that day, and her daughter, Princess Zaianna officiated the event in her place. She wore an Amazon military uniform that was adorned with golden plating and exotic jewels from around the globe.

"Citizens of Castle Gain," The princess began, "Your esteemed Princess Fiona has come here today to weigh herself right here in front of all of you. We hope she serves as a great role model for all of the women here today." She paused for a moment while Fiona came onstage. "Fiona's weight should meet or exceed 155 pounds."

Fiona steps onto the scale and it reveals that her weight is...

1121.content:
Fiona walked on stage. Her minimal attire exposed her new flesh for all to see. The townspeople hope dropped as they saw their princess, ubiquitously known as a slender woman, dragged her self to the scale. Those up close could see her thighs wobble. Fiona wanted nothing more than to cover her embarrassing body. Her panties dug into her sides as her butt swallowed the garments. She had little control of her boobs which were spilling out of her now undersized bra. Her belly, that had always been flat, was now bulging.

Fiona wanted to cry.

Fiona wanted to cry but held it in. She knew that emotionally breaking down is exactly what the Amazons craved. More than anything else, Fiona wanted to deny them that satisfaction. Despite holding her tears, the Amazons reveled in the princess's humiliation.

"Yeah! Lookin good princess!" "How bout a little dance!" "Give us a show!" "Get a load of the Princess's figure!"
shouted the boisterous Amazons.

Prince Bradley could only grit his teeth as he watched his sister's weigh in. Amelia could only whimper.

Amazonian princess Zaianna smiled as Fiona stepped up to the scale. "Hop on princess." Zaianna snidely teased, giving Fiona a smack on the ass.

Stepping on the scale, Fiona clenched, shutting her eyes. Her emotions were incoherent. She hated how much heavier she'd weigh, while fearing weighing below the 155 mark.

"Whoa Princess!"

Fiona opened her eyes, flustered by Zaianna's exclamation.

"160! Damn Princess, if I'd have known you'd be so attuned to gaining, I would've raised the weight requirement." laughed Zaianna patting Fiona on the back.

"I-I gained 5 more pounds than I had to..."Fiona muttered.

"Enjoy it Princess!" Zaianna wrapped her arm around Fiona "for this is just the beginning." Zaianna ominously teased.

"Okay! People of Gainger! Let Princess Fiona's new flesh serve as an example to you. From now on all women of age must meet a weight requirement which will increase every month until satisfaction. Within one week, every Gainger woman must weigh at least 160 pounds.."

Fiona flinched at the altered requirement knowing she was responsible.

"Now let us commence the weighings. Pay for your freedom."

The women of Gainger mourned as they began eating, while the women who were already fat stepped on the scale to meet their first monthly requirement.

1122.content:

"All women of age should look upon this woman and accept their fate and accept Amazon supremacy. As of now all women on their 18th birthday will celebrate with a fattening feast. Furthermore a weight gain of 10 pounds is required of every woman every month from this day forth. Citizens of Castle Gain gaze upon your women's fat slow bodies and remember the superiority of Amazons. Thanks to a new magic a woman's weight can never plateau. I, Princess Zaianna wish all of you young women a long delicious life." Weight gain elixirs will be massed produced and food growth will be tripled."
Meanwhile every woman is stuffing herself, salesmen are selling weight gain elixirs, and thin women stared at their soon to be fat, bodies. Jennifer went up to Fiona who was looking sullen as she ate a turkey leg to work on next month's requirements. "My lady is there anything I can do" the blonde servant girl said. "Join me in feasting Jennifer for you too must gain, but first let me see your thin body before you fill it with fat." Fiona said. Jennifer than posed and twirled her 110 pound body before digging into some cake. Meanwhile the other servant girl, Rebecca was clinging to Bradley "My lord do I really have to do this too?" "Yes I'm afraid so you and Jennifer must gain, if the Amazons saw any skinny woman they would fatten her up to immobilty." Bradley gloomily said handing her a weight gain elixir and some turkey.

Weight gain elixirs were flying off the shelves and women were beginning to look overall pudgier. One woman after the other was weighed each fulfilling the weight requirements. Some cried at their forced fattening some were relieved others were stuffing themselves for one lastminute weigh in. 12.content:
The Fattening Elements- In the Grand Land’s, there is a wandering guild of the six most powerful mages in the land, each one commanding one of the six grand elements.

There is the somber wind walker who uses Sky Magic Ariel Skylark. Her eyes are as blue as the sky and hair as white as clouds. She is the youngest but also the most mature of the small guild and often serves as a mediator in any arguments or fights that might break out between the others. Arial is a passionate reader, which is about the only thing she shows passion for, or any other emotions for that matter, and brings a pack full of her personal collection of books where ever she goes.

Sandra Steel the Terrain Mage is a curvy brunet with a great attitude and isn’t afraid to show it. As far as appearance goes, Sandra is far from vain, but still tries to look her best. In their group of mages, Sandra is the oldest, but just like Ariel, she doesn’t act her age; instead, she acts like an immature schoolgirl.

The Lightning Mage Joel Tucker (or Jolt) is a mad man with extreme amounts of energy. The hazel eyed blond mage enjoys playing pranks that usually involving electric shock, running around at lighting speed, making loud noises, and just about anything that could, and most like would, get on his guild-mates nerves.

Rosanna Thorn has sage green hair, true green eyes and is just as gentle and delicate as the plants her magic allows her to control; only her magic makes the plants much stronger, while the sage haired mage stays just as timid and weak.

Finally Blaine and Flo Magus are brother and sister who are almost exact opposites. While Blaine is a joyful, talkative and enthusiastic Fire Mage with red hair and amber eyes, Flo is a Water Sprite Mage with blue eyes and cyan hair, who is very unpleasant to be around when she is being mean or is angry, which is most of the time. In fact, the only thing they have in common is a love for getting their eight hours. Normally, Flo would have an advantage against a Fire Mage, but to survive Blaine has come up with a few tricks that help even things out, unfortunately they only work for him and not his guild-mates.

Magic's.
Ariel: Wind, Flying and Force Magic.
Sandra: Terrain, Mineral, Strength and Golem Magic.
Joel: Lightning, Plasma, and Speed Magic.
Rosanna: Plant, Healing and Regeneration Magic.
Blaine: Blazing, Freezing, Defusing and Nine Angel's Magic.
Flo: Flowing, Freezing, Reflecting, and Lunar Magic.

Goddess Fatten it- Weight gain of divine proportions happens here.

Halfling Club- In the less safe regions of Honger there is a pair of bounty hunters: The Human Lucas, and the Human-Fairy hybrid Fliter.

Because of his blood red eyes, long black hair and his over all 'creature of the night' appearance, people are often afraid of Lucas, even though he's one of the kindest men you could ever meet, while Fliter's blue eyes and white hair hide her mischievous nature that most Fairy's have. Because of her Human blood, Fliter stands much taller than any pureblood Fairies at four and a half feet tall, but is still dwarfed by the seven foot Lucas.

As bounty hunters, Lucas and Fliter have run across two of the lands most infamous 'freelance workers', as they prefer to be called, named Woo and Mi. Woo is a gray haired half Human half Hobgoblin hybrid, Mi is a white haired Halfling Elf, and both of them are willing to do any job for the right amount of coin. Normally, Hobgoblins hate Elves, and when people see the petite Mi being followed by the muscular Woo they try to warn her of the danger, only to get a laugh in response as they continue on their way. Because most of their 'freelancing' involves illegal activates, Woo and Mi have had to deal with Lucas and Fliter on multiple occasions, though sometimes, when their interest don’t contradict, they work together…but that rarely happens.

Shame on Fame- In the last few miles before the Human and Goblin countries connect, there is town called 'The Last Resort'. It is a collection of multiple shops, inns, pubs and spas that specializes in tending to the every need of the guest and is all owned by a single woman named Elizabeth.

Elizabeth is an ill tempered woman with brown colored hair and eyes, who is often mistaken for a Dwarf because of her height and chubby body, and those who do make that mistake end up with a crossbow bolt to the knee, and a three night ban from the town (if she's in a good mood). Lately, things have begun to slow down and become boring Elizabeth, but that will change when the half Human, half Giant adventuress with violet hair and eyes Leona, along with her unwanted Ogre sidekick Jonk, comes to stay at The Last Resort, especially since she is a mage, and Elizabeth is amused by even the simplest of tricks.
12.title: Fantasy Fattening Stories.

121.content:
3:25 AM.

Rosanna shot up from the mat she was sleeping on after she was suddenly woken from her slumber by someone tripping over her. She scanned the camp sight, looking for the culprit, when her eyes came to rest on the familiar glow of golden hair, reflecting the moon light. “J-Jolt, what are you doing? I could have been Flo!” She half whispered half yelled.

Her guild mate Joel Tucker then slowly picked him self up off of the ground and whipped dirt off his clothes before responding in a light whisper, “Yeah, so could I, then who’d be angry?”

“Yeah…but really, why are you up so late, and…what’s that thing on your head?”

“Thing, what thing,” Joel reached for his head and took of a gold crown with several gems embedded in it. “I BURIED YOU!”

“Shhh, you’re going to wake Flo up, and why are you yelling?”

“Because he’s been following me for years,”

“…H-he?”

“Yes, he, and no matter what I do, I can never get rid of him!”

“Okay, Jolt, please, just stop yelling and I’ll help you deal with your problem later, okay?”

“If you two don’t shut up and go to sleep I’ll deal with both of you as problems later.” Came a third voice, one that caused Rosanna to hide underneath her blanket, and Joel to fall flat on his face into the dirt, and stayed there motionlessly for the rest of the night.

5:15 AM.

The sun slowly rose up on the horizon as the first rays of sunshine started the day, and Ariel was finishing her book. It was the third installment of her favorite saga, titled “Time-walker: The Grand Dragon”.

After reading the last page, she whipped a single tear from her eye and cursed the woman who wrote it for causing her to feel that way before slipping the book back into her pack. She looked down at the ground from the tree she spent the night in to see the others starting to wake up (again) and decided that she should join them in starting the day. She slung her pack around her should, took her lantern in her other hand, jumped off the branch she’d been sitting on and slowly floated down.

As Ariel got closer to the ground, she heard one of the guilds morning rituals, deciding who had to wake Flo up. “...I don’t care, she’s already mad at us, there’s no way either of us is doing it!” Joel protested while patting down a patch of freshly dug up dirt.

“Yeah well…me and Sandy shouldn’t be anywhere near her or her pack, because somebody though it would be a good idea to go through it, and ended up stealing her diary!” Blaine said, looking at Sandra as she whistled innocently with a look of ignorance on her face.

“She has a diary? You know she’s probably going to kill you just for telling us she even has a diary!”

“Which is why we read it, I mean, if she’s already going to kill us, then what did we have to lose?”

“We, us? No, you stole it from he pack, you read it to me while I was trying to sleep, and you are going to wake her up!”

“You four can go ahead and get changed, I’ll wake Ms. Magus.” Ariel offered in her usual dry tone, smoothing out any creases in her long white skirt that may have formed after she landed.

Without hesitation, the four other mages ran of to change into there day clothes, while Ariel walked over to the still sleeping Flo. At some point in the night, she must have noticed Ariel wasn’t going to be sleeping, since she had taken her mat and had placed it on top of hers, as well as wrapped herself in both Ariel’s and her own blanket…or she could have had no idea and just took them.

Ariel bent down and placed her hand on Flo and began to gently push her back and forth. “Ms. Magus, I apologize if you are still tiered, but you must wake up now and get changed, before the forest predators begin to wake; I would rather not have to fish Jolt out of the stomach of yet another ursus-araneus…that reminds me, we will need to pick up more honey the next time we are in a town.”

“Honey? Oh…can I have five more minutes, Honey?” The Cyan haired girl said before wrapping her arm around a clump of blanket and burying her face in it.

“Excuse me?”

“Mmm, did ya say somthin’?”

6:13 AM.

“Alright, I’m all done!” Blaine said as he stepped out from behind a tree. He had changed out of his simple night clothes and into his Seraph armor; several golden armor plantings that are worn on the forearms, shoulders, the upper chest, upper back, lower legs, on top of his poofy white shirt and black pants, and had styled his red hair into spikes.

“I-I am, too…” Rosanna had risen up out of a pile of leaves, now dressed in her green chemise with a vine like belt going around her waist and a leather breastplate that covered her front, while she tried to pick some leaves out of the braid in her long sage colored hair.

“I’m all set, too!” Sandra said after jumping out of a hole in the ground and landing with a thud. She now wore instead of a long brown nightgown, a waist length vest with buttons over a short sleeved shirt that was a few shades darker than the orange of the vest, as well as an even darker orange colored skirt, with all signs of her bed head combed away so that her brown, shoulder length hair framed her round face. “Don’t I look cute~”

“’Bout time, you guys took almost an hour to change! It only took me and Ariel five minutes at most!” Flo complained as she got up of the ground and dusted off her aqua blue sarong that wrapped around her waist. She also wore a deep blue bikini top that barley held her large breast in place and had pulled her cyan into a pony tail that hung over her left shoulder.

“Excuse me, but dose anyone know where Mr. Tucker?” Ariel asked, now clad in another one of her white dresses.

“Uh, I’m up here…but I’m not sure how to get back down…” Every one looked up and saw Joel sitting on a branch of the tallest tree, still wearing the same clothes as before. The yellowed shirt he wore only had a right sleeve, while his left forearm was clothed by a separate sleeve held in place by two leather belts, one at his wrist and one at his elbow. Covering his lower half, were a pair of pants the same faded color as his shirt, with both legs stopping at the knees, with separate pant legs held in place the same way as the sleeve on his left arm.

“J-Jolt, what are you doing up their? You didn’t even need to change!”

“I know…I just got bored waiting and…yeah…can someone help me down? I forgot that I’m afraid of heights…”

“I’ll get him down.” Flo said before bending over to pick up a rock.

7:05 AM.

“…I’m just saying that if we didn’t have to wait for Jolt’s bones to be healed we could have been half way to the next town by now!” Blaine complained as he and the others continued their way along a forest path.

“And I’m just sayin’, if he didn’t climb up there in the first place, I wouldn’t of had to knock his ass back down! So if you don’ want to end up like him, you better shut up! GOT IT!”

“Perhaps I should purchase a book on phobias to keep this from happening in the future.”

“W-we should get some more elixir too; I used it all up closing the wound left by the rock he landed on.”

“Heheh, yeah, I should have put a softer rock there.”

“I can’t feel my anything!”

“Wait…does any one else here that?”

“Yeah…sounds like…

...Spider-Bears!" After spending the rest of the day running from giant monster, the guild takes refuge in a mansion hidden in the woods that is home to some people Ariel is very familiar with.

-giant wings flapping!” After slaying a massive dragon, the guild makes its cave their new base of operations.

...thunder but…not thunder.” A massive magic storm is coming their way, and the guild takes cover in the nearest town until it blows over.
121.title: Morning routine.

1211.content:
New characters of this story line.
Juliet Love.
Blake Smith.
Catharine Cook.
Winona Walker.
Maxus Walker.
Katelyn Clark.

“I, *huff*, think we, *huff*, lost them!” Blaine groaned as he and four of his fellow mages came to a stop after being chased by a pack of spider-bears for nearly the whole day, only being able to lose the creatures just as the sun began to set.

“Damn…we’ll never find our way back to the path.” Flo pointed out, completely unfazed by the long day of being hunted. “Even if we do, by the time we make it to the town, they’ll probably have sold the place to another guild. So no matter what we do it looks like we won’t be having a permanent headquarters anytime soon, maybe we should just set up camp for the night and worry about it in the morning.”

“That may not be necessary.” Ariel said as she drifted down and rejoined the group. As the others were running, she had taken to the skies, and while she was up there, she had spotted something interesting. “When I was strategically evading the ursus-araneus, I spotted a very large mansion up ahead, it was very well hidden under the trees, but it was there. If we approach the owner of the home, we could ask to stay the night. Or at the very least send us in the direction of town.”

“Yeah, *huff*, that sounds, *puff*, like a good plan, *huff*, can someone carry me there?” Blaine begged, and when everyone began to follow Ariel he groaned even louder before limping after them.

After about a ten minute walk, they arrived at the large building. Based on window placement, it appeared to have three above ground floors, four if you counted the attic, and was so massive it was hard to tell how big it even was. The house wasn’t in the best condition, but it was by no means uninhabitable, just some chipped paint here, some vines growing up the walls there and a few loose shingles on the roof. All in all, it didn’t look like anything anyone would expect to find

“Wow, you really weren’t kidding when you said this place was really big!” Flo commented as she walked up the steps to the mansions front door. She raised her arm and began to whale on the door several times, before it was finally opened by a beautiful young woman with strawberry blond hair wearing a black suit…though there wasn’t much time to take in the woman’s appearance, because she shut the door faster than she opened it. “What the hell, that bitch didn’t even ask what we want!”

“Maybe they’re eating dinner; we always come knocking when we’re eating dinner!”

“Jolt I…you…just go climb another tree. I’m knocking again, maybe I’ll get someone more polite this time, and if it’s that last servant again I can punch that bitch in the face!” Flo then knocked (more like punched) on the door three more times, this time it was opened by a man in a similar suit as the woman, only it ha sever overlapping white lines going all across it.

Most of his hair was short and black, but there was a long strand of white hair framing either side of his face, the left one being much thinner and reaching his shoulder, the right on only came down to his chin, and was much thicker. “Hello, how may I help you today-err…tonight?”

“My name is Flo, me and my-”

“Wait, no! I’m not supposed to let you in! Please try again later!” Once again, the door was slammed in Flo’s face.

“Uh, well, m-maybe we should just g-go and set up c-camp for the n-night…and try to f-find the path on our own…” Rosanna suggested, only receiving an angry glare from Flo in response.

“Yeah, let’s keep trying; I wanna see a giant chicken open the door next!” Joel said while flapping his arms like wings.

Sandra laughed. “As much as I know that that’s not going to happen, I still want to see that happen!”

“As long as we’re hoping, I kind of want to see a sexy maid open it next!” Every one stared at Blaine. “What? Those two were butlers…sort of, so why can’t a maid answer it next? That would be a lot more likely than a giant chicken!”

“Uh, excuse me, may I help you?” Every one changed their focus again to turn around and see a blond woman, arms over loaded with food supplies in bags, standing behind the group of mages, clad in a black and white maid’s uniform.

Stepping past Blaine’s victory dancing and wolf whistling (that latter of which got him pounded into the ground by Flo), Ariel approached the blond maid and explained their situation to her. “…and we would be gratefully appreciative if you would allow us to stay the night here, and then point us in the direction of the nearest town in the morning. We have our own food, so you won’t have to feed us, if that makes you any more willing to let us stay.”

“That won’t be any problem, our chef loves to cook, the more the merrier. In fact, she was going to prepare a very large griffon for dinner tonight-“

“Giant chicken!”

“…So we would have ended up with a lot of left over’s had you not come along.” The blond continued after Joel’s outburst, her confused expression hidden behind the bags.

“I assume your response means that you are welcoming us to stay?”

“Of course, our mistress loves it when we have guest…though she is trying to recover from a rather nasty cold, so please try not to bother her too much or cause a lot of noise.” The group exchanged nervous looks but followed the blond maid inside, though for Blaine it was more like following her skirt.

(Edit: I made a mistake involving a character in this, and in another storyline, but they're gone now.)

12111.content:
New characters’: Magic update.
Juliet Love: Shielding Magic.
Blake Smith: Weapon, Armor and Blacksmith Magic.
Catharine Cook: Culinary Magic.
Winona Walker: Wind, Flying, Force, Transformation and Youth Magic.
Maxus Walker: Time, Space and Dimensional Magic.
Katelyn Clark: None.

The maid had promised to show them to some rooms as soon as she put the supplies away, and after fumbling with them several times, Flo offered to help her to keep the blond from slowing down any more, but even with her carrying half the bags, the maid's face was still hidden, and now so was Flo's. "Damn! How the hell can you tell where you’re going?” Flo asked as the maid led them down countless hallways.

“Oh, well…it’s hard to explain. We all just sort of find our way around; you’d have to ask Maxus, I can introduce you to him later.”

“Hmm, would you mind telling us what your name is?” Ariel asked.

Without breaking her stride, the maid replied, “My name is Juliet.”

“What a lovely name!” Said Blaine, his eyes still glued to Juliet’s skirt as he imagined what it was hiding.

Eventually, Juliet stopped outside a door had Ariel open it, revealing an absolutely massive kitchen, with the strawberry blond inside holding a tray with a cup of tea and a bowl of soup. Thankfully, Flo still couldn’t see anything past the bags and didn’t lose her mind.

Until she put the bags down that is.

“YOU,” She yelled, causing the suit wearing woman to raise an eyebrow in confusion. “You better apologize for slamming that door in my face you bitch!” The woman opened her mouth to say something, but closed it back when Flo charged at her.

Without a moments hesitation the servant tossed the tray into the air, spun around Flo’s attack causing her to lose balance and fall to the floor and stomped her foot onto Flo’s chest, all before catching the falling tray without spilling a single drop of soup or tea. With Flo and the others left paralyzed by shock, the servant took the opportunity to cast a spell. “Weaponry Magic: Ruby Rapier!” In the servant’s free hand, a long pointed sword with no edge and cup shaped hilt that appeared to be flawlessly cut from a single ruby that must have been massive in size began to form, and when it was fully materialized, the point was placed as close to Flo’s chest as it could be without it piercing through her. “Juliet, should I execute these intruders?”

“Wait what?!” Juliet was the only one who had missed the attack thanks to the bags, but even when the other servant asked permission to kill their guest, she did not drop the bag. “No, Blake, they aren’t intruders, they’re our guest!” She said as she began to panic.

“Oh, I see; my apologies then Ma’am.” The servant named Blake apologized after taking her foot off Flo, her rapier disappearing soon after. “I should go take these to the Mistress before they begin to cool.” Blake the turned and exited the kitchen, allowing the Guild Mages to recover from shock.

“I...I didn’t expect that bitch to be a Mage! I would never have let that happen if I had known!” Flo said with what started out with shocked tone and expression, but both quickly turned to ones of anger.

“I’m really sorry for the way Blake acted,” Juliet apologized as she finally set down the bags on a counter, still keeping her back to the others even as she unpacked them. “Let’s just say that Blake doesn’t like reacts badly when around people he’s not used to seeing.”

Blaine’s eyes went wide. “That was a guy? Damn, he was hotter than me, and I’m pretty smoking!”

Sandra laughed. “Ha, smoking, fire, hot! I get it!”

“That wasn’t a joke…are you trying to say I’m not attractive!”

“Why, are you getting steamed, hot head? Maybe you need to cool down, we all know how fired up you can--oop, shit!”

When Blaine started chasing Sandra around the kitchen with a sword made of fire, Ariel let out a sigh, and hoped that they wouldn’t be kicked out. “I guess that I am the only one who could actually tell that was a man.”

Flo crossed her arms over her chest. “No, he didn’t have boobs, I noticed right away, I just like bitch better than bastard.” Ariel gave Flo a confused stare but her attention was brought back to Juliet when she started talking again.

“Yes, quite a few people make that mistake, which is one of the reasons for his attitude.” Juliet said before taking one final jar out of a bag. "Alright, I can show you guys to a room now-” Juliet froze when she turned around and saw the Mages for the first time, and after scanning each one of them with her dark brown eyes, she continued with a deep red blush on her face. “Oh…um I-I didn’t realize that you were...so many in number.”

“If that will be a problem then we can leave-”

Juliet shook her head. “N-no, I mean, that’s not what I meant. We have plenty of room here for all of you…” She protested, cutting of Ariel mid sentence. “Uh…I’ll show you to s-some rooms now.” She began to walk out of the kitchen the remaining bag on her arm, but stopped before reaching the door. “Um, before I forget, which one of you was the one who helped me with the bags?” Flo rolled her eyes and let one arm fall from its crossed position across her chest down to her side while she raised the other one. “W-well, thank you very much…um…oh I’m so sorry! I’ve completely forgotten to ask any of your names!”

“That’s okay beautiful, it just didn’t come up; my names Blaine Mages, and that’s my sister Flo.” Blaine said with a sweet tone.

“And I’m Sandra Steel, but you can call me Sandy.” Sandra began as she picked herself up off a charred section of the floor, and once she was fully erect she proceeded to point to each of the other guild members as she introduced them, “Blondie over there is Joel Tucker, but we call him Jolt, the girl in green is Rosanna Thorn, and the one in the pretty white dress is Ariel Skylark!”

“Well…those are all very…unique names. Uh…c-come with me, I’ll show you to your rooms now…again.” Juliet then whipped around and hurried out of the kitchen and the others following soon after, but with Ariel and Blaine lagging a little bit behind.

“Is it me, or is Ms. Juliet behaving more nervously now that she has seen us?”

“Maybe she’s been dumbstruck by my handsomeness!”

Ariel gave Blaine a short glare before quickening her pace to catch up to the others.

It wasn’t until they crossed though twelve hallways, gone up three flights of stairs and then down two that Juliet stopped outside another. “This should be it.” She then opened the door to reveal a very large room, with three beds pushed up against the right wall, and two beds pressed up against the left with a gap between them where a sixth bed could be place, but instead, it was in the middle of the room, where the man in the strange suit laid unconscious. “Oh…looks like he ran out of energy.”

“YOU,” Flo yelled at the sleeping man. “You are defiantly going to get it! And I’m not going to make the same mistake twice, either! Freezing Magic: Ice-”

“Oh that was just dumb. Haven’t you ever heard of letting sleeping dogs lie?”

“W-what,” Once again Flo found herself pinned to the floor by one of the servants, only this time she hadn’t even seen him move or feel him attack. She was just instantly on her front…with the odd man sitting cross legged on her bare back. “Get the hell off of me!” With a wrenching motion Flo sent the butler of her back and got to her feet. “How the fuck do you people keep doing that?!”

“Uh…Flo…” Flo whipped around to the others ready to bite someone’s head off, when she noticed that they were either diverting there gaze, or staring at her frozen in place with slack jaw and flushed in the face.

“…Interesting, to say the least,” Ariel said, her being the only one with a straight face.

“…Oh my…” Juliet said with her head turned, but her eyes locked on Flo.

“Why the hell am I looking?!” Blaine asked more to himself than to the others.

“Damn, attitude or not how is she single?” Sandra questioned.

“They look even bigger now…” Rosanna marveled, a hand resting subconsciously on her flat leather chest plate.

“…Boobs!” Joel shouted as loud as he could.

With her left eye twitching, Flo quickly crossed her arms over her bare chest. “Where…the hell…IS MY TOP,”

“I took it, I noticed it looked a little too small for you, so I got you one that won’t constrict their size as much,” The butler said handing over a darker, admittedly much larger yet equally skimpy bikini top over to Flo and she quickly put it on. “You should replace the rest as well by the way; you are definitely not a D-cup.” Flo threw a punch at the butler, but without even looking he caught it, and continued with her fist clenched tightly in his hand. “Now as for beds, girls on right, guys on left. I was moving the bed to the other side but…well…yeah. Anyway, this will have to do until I can set up more permanent accommodations.”

“Permanent? Maxus, these are guests.” Juliet corrected.

“…Alright, but tell me, did I let them in?”

“NO! You slammed the door in my face!” Flo said, still trying to get free of Maxus’s grasp, and after a shrug of the shoulder, he let her go. Then, without saying another word, he walked to the door, picked Juliet up, slung her over his shoulder and left the guild in the room.

An hour later, someone comes to the guilds room, but who is it?

A cat with gray fur that takes a liking to Flo and Ariel,

The chef Catharine Cook, who has been sent to collect them for dinner, and she's almost as weird as Joel!

(Edit: I made a mistake involving a character in this, and in another storyline, but they're gone now.)

1223.content:
'Lady of Battle, send us an angel, Lady of War, send us a savior, Lady of Succor, send us a warrior,' Priestess Jostlin prayed again and again, voice rasping from her dry throat.

The Priestess was short (5' even) and would have been mousey with her big brown eyes, freckles and soft brown hair if there'd been enough flesh to count as mousey. Instead she was bone thin, almost fleshlessly svelte with hollow cheeks and sunken eyes, her neck painfully thin and her fingers bony. Her brown robe had always been loose but now was hanging off her breastless, hipless frame like a tent. Sweet and shy, she was as far as could be imagined from a cleric of the Triune Goddesses, three divine siblings of war, love and wisdom who were depicted in mosaics and statues around her chapel. (in order) There was Vola, the voluptuous, black haired beauty of joy, love and sex, Hesta, the dark skinned, kinky haired patron of art, wisdom and learning and finally Fenra, the tall, muscularly curvacious bringer of victory and protector of the weak.

'Please Fenra, send us aid,' the little priestess begged as the castle walls shook from bombardment, 'the orcs have harried us so long, we're out of food, out of spells, out of time. My lover fights to hold the line but unless we have a miracle...please I will give anything...'

Jostlin felt her hair stand on end and for the first time in weeks, a warm strength filled her body. On the altar her last candles flared to painful, blinding light and when she could at last look back she was no longer alone. A woman stood on the sacred stone, or rather floated:

8 feet of divinely carved glory, from the tips of her armored boots up her powerful, chiseled thighs over narrow, girlish hips and an armored bulging with more muscles than all the castle guards had ever had put together on display, leading up to an armored bra cradling two huge, athletic, almost threatening bosoms and hard, bulging arms bigger than Jostlin's thighs had ever been. Her skin was glowing alabaster without a scar or blemish and her golden blonde hair glowed like the sunrise from where it fell over a winged headress. Two pairs of golden wings erupted from her back, out stretched and beating softly and her face was hard to look at it was so perfectly beautiful, while in her gloved hands was a jet black long sword, six feet tall from tip to tip and covered in divine runes.

'Fenra!' Jostlin squeaked, falling to her face in supplication.

'No child, I am not the goddess, merely an angel,' the divinity smiled, showing dazzling white teeth that left after images, 'your request has been heard and I was sent to save you.'

'I...I thank you so much,' Jostlin sobbed, relief and the feeling of safety flowing over her, 'I was so afraid...'

She stepped down, putting the hundred pound sword over her shoulder and gently cupping Jostlin's chin with hands that could have easily juggled the biggest horse in the castle, back before they'd eaten all the horses.

'Be not afraid, for you have proven devoted to the goddess, always making such small sacrifices even from your dismal rations,' the angels smiled at her, 'I wish I could have come sooner but there are so many evils in the worlds and so few of us great warrior angels. Come now, witness the victory I shall offer to the Goddess!'

'What...what is your name?' Jostlin asked, overcome with happiness.

'I am Kelara, Angel of Bountiful Victory,' the giant celestial smiled at her, 'and you little one are Jostlin, always a brave one despite your quietness the Goddess had noted. Always devout and kind and seeing to the needy, a warrior in your own way. Do not worry again though, soon you will be saved.'

Jostlin followed as Kelara walked out of the chapel, through the halls of desperate refugees who fell to their knees weeping at this divine servitor and into the court yard where the few hundred surviving men at arms (out of a ten thousand man garrison) led by her boyfriend Sir Hal prepared to sell their lives dearly. Kelara entered just as the orc horde broke down the gates, a tide of green insanity spilling into the castle. The carnage was horrific and entirely one sided, the orcs had all the chance against the arc angel that a field of wheat had against a scythe. So fast was she that a green mist appeared between where she first drew her sword and the castle gates and entire schools of swordsmanship would have been founded just to study the angle of her ankle if any mortal eye could have seen her step.

Fifty thousand orcs, all the monsters of the northern mountains, were felled in less than an hour, leaving their bodies stretched out over the winter fields. Kelara fluttered gently down into the castle square, wiping her great sword clean with the Orcs sacred banner. There was not a scratch or stain on her body.

'Rejoice, for you are delivered,' Kelara beamed at the awestruck, weeping crowd, 'from the orcs!'

Th angel looked them over, taking in their gaunt, stared appearances. Few civilians had actually died, it seemed the food had been well managed but all were near starved. Jostlin, a maid of 22 summers should have had full breasts, round hips and probably a belly beginning to round with child, such was the love between her and her boyfriend, palpable to Kelara's angelic sight. As was their starvation, in the high heavens all were athletic and perfect but here on the mortal realm things were so precarious, these people would likely die of starvation in a month if she didn't do something. It shouldn't be this way but the battle against the abyss' evil required the goddesses to spend so much divine energy...divine energy like that laying around from the army of devil worshiping orcs she'd slaughtered. It had been born of malice but now stood neutral, able to be used by the first one with the will and skill to shape it.

'...and from hunger!' the warrior angel continued, pointing out her sword and gathering unused divine magic into it and making it rain down on the barren, unplanted fields.

The orc horde had cut down trees and dug up roots, creating two hundred square miles of desert in what should have been productive farm country. With a wave of her blade, Kelara turned it into something from the heavens: rolling hills of lush pasturage populating by mooing, house sized dairy cows with full udders and happy, baaing sheep the size of ponies, flocks of dog sized chickens and pig sized ducks that would lay a hundred eggs a day, winding orchards heavy with fruit the size of human heads, berry patches big enough to hold a carnival in and endless rows of wheat, barely, hops, corn, potatoes, tomatoes, peppers, onions, radishes and all the other stuff humans should eat. Despite the winter chill everywhere else, it was a pleasant spring day in this new mega farm. Kelara wasn't exactly sure on what human farms looked like but she felt a strange joy at creating such fecundity.

'How...how can we repay you?' Jostlin begged, seeing the salvation of her people.

'Remember the goddesses who protect you, pray, be grateful, happy, brave and kind!' was what Kelara said, before she vanished in a puff of white light.

What followed was the greatest feast in the kingdom's history. Scared, starving men and women ate and ate and ate, to their amazement finding that the trees and plants instantly regrew as soon as they were picked, yielding perfect fruit each time. In joy they ate and ate and ate, until they were pinned to the ground by their own groaning bellies. One goblin with a bread knife could have ended the kingdom there and then, everyone was so helpless, but Kelara had ended all threats with her blade.

Hal and Jostlin sat lazily in the great hall, his sword belt undone to accommodate his feasted paunch and Jostlin's tent like dress stretched tight over her monumental food baby. At the moment, neither of the two former starvlings had the energy for sex, but both new it would come in a day or two, once their salvation would sink in. Fierce love, burning hot at their desperate survival was fueling a life long fire of passion.

'I suppose we should get married,' Hal said, running his finger over her immense food baby, 'I'm the last knight in the kingdom and will need a queen...'

'Of course I accept, even if you're an unromantic ass,' Jostlin giggled, punching his arm lightly, 'but first, I must sacrifice...'

Getting up was miserable but Jostlin made her way to the temple, bearing a forty pound tray of fruit and vegetables that her skinny arms could barely carry and had to rest on her tender belly. She sat it on the altar and bowed well as she could, smiling at where the angel had appeared.

'I give this back to you Kelara, who saved all of us. Know I will never forget you and I and my daughters will sacrifice to you forever!' the Priestess grinned.

A world away, Kelara trade blows with a fire demon a hundred feet high. She heard the prayer of thanks, directed not at her patron Fenra and felt herself grow stronger, striking a hard blow that shattered the magma fiend and sent it spiraling apart.

Actual worship? How odd...she hoped it didn't get out of hand...

124.content:
“Hmm, so this is Last Resort huh? I have to admit I wasn’t expecting it to be so…much.” Leona said as she walked down the dirt path that led to the gated entrance of the last resort. A very tall stone brick wall kept her from seeing the streets and most of the buildings, but there were quite a few buildings that rose up hire than the wall; very impressive for a town so far away from the others.

“Yes, it very much,” Leona’s Ogre companion Jonk agreed. He followed her where ever she went ever since she saved his life and no matter how hard she tried she couldn’t shake the annoyingly grateful Ogre. So she made him carry her stuff.

Shaking her head, Leona stopped in the middle of the street and turned to Jonk, who took a little longer to slow his giant stride to a stop. “Hand me my cloak and our papers, I’m pretty sure there going to want to check them before letting us in.”

“Promise you really gonna give mine this time?” Jonk asked as he handed a bag to Leona.

“I promise…” Leona left off as she pulled a cloak out of the bag and draped it over herself, using the hood to hide her bright violet hair from view, which would help to keep her from being recognized. “…That I will do no such thing!” She finished before taking off running for the gate, but as Leona approached it, she saw that people were passing right by the guards and into the town, and thus her hopes of losing her unwanted companion were once again dashed away.

The reason that Leona had came to Last Resort was because she was in need of some rest and relaxation, and she decided that it would be the ideal place for her to have it. Not only because Last Resort had a reputation as one of the greatest vacation destinations in the land, but because it was so far out of the way that even if someone spotted her violet hair and eyes, they probably wouldn’t recognize her as the famous warrior who’d saved the land countless times. And she could finally have some time to just be Leona.

“Excuses me, miss, could you please help us?” A weak voice from behind her asked.

“Or maybe not…” Leona muttered under her breath. She was going to say no to whomever it was who asked, but when she saw three little girls standing behind her, well, that wasn’t an option any more. “Of course, what do you need?”

All three girls were different ages, but all had ginger hair and wore a black bow. “Well, we don’t want to bother you, but Daisy just ran up that tree, and you and your friend look like the only ones tall enough to reach her.” The middle girl replied, pointing up to orange cat lying on a tree branch.

“We’d get her our selves, but our big sis said we’re not allowed to climb the trees...anymore…” The youngest added, glaring at the oldest.

“It wasn’t my fault I fell! You were throwing rocks at me!” She defended.

“Don’t worry; I’ll get her down for you.” Leona said, giving the children a wide grin before walking over the tree. She reached up for the cat but ever at her height she was barely tall enough to reach. But eventually she had plucked the cat out of the tree and handed it to the middle child.

“Thank you so much, Miss!” They all said at once.

“It was nothing really. Now run along and don’t let her out of your sight again.”

“We won’t!” The youngest and middle called out as they ran off, taking the cat with them and leaving the oldest behind.

“Thank you again miss, our big sister would have been so mad if we lost Daisy again. Is there anything I can do to thank you?” The oldest asked.

“Hmm, there is one thing. Can you tell me if you know of any place I can stay while I’m in town?”

“Well, the whole town is full of nice inns for you to stay the night, but if you want the best than you want Desire. It’s like the whole town wrapped up into one place! The town owner lives there, too. It’s sorta like the town hall or something…I think…me and my younger sisters aren’t old enough to go there yet. But our older sister goes there all the time to meet her friend, and she always comes back with the biggest smile!”

“It sounds nice, I think I’ll stay there, thank you for telling me.” The girl then smiled brightly and took off after her sisters.

Leona and Jonk then continued on down the cobblestone roads looking for building called “Desire”, and it took a while of wandering around before she remembered the little girl didn’t give her any directions. It was hard finding someone willing to stop what ever they were doing to actually talk to her. Then she had another embarrassing moment when they told her it was the tallest building in the center of town, which made sense seeing as how important that little girl made it sound, and not long after that Leona and Jonk found the building.

Once inside, Leona figured out exactly why those girls weren’t allowed in, it was an absolute mad house! What could be seen of the first floor was somewhat like a pub, with a bar, tables and booths to sit as well as several wenches and grooms serving food and drink to their three types of patrons. There were the drunks, who were absolutely out of it thanks to whatever it was they were being served. Then there were the brawlers, who threw punches and chairs at each other, only stopping to consume their order or flirt with their server. And finally there were the lovers, ranging from first date couples, all the way to do-me-right-here-on-the-table couples. Though all of them stopped what they were doing when they noticed Leona and Jonk walk in.

Leona and her ten foot ogre acquaintance were stared at intently by the patrons, causing her survival instincts to kick in…or at least the first part of it, namely assessing whether fight or flight were her best options. There were about eighty patrons and twenty staff workers staring at her, with the bulk of them having…well, bulk to them. Whether that “bulk” was muscle or fat seemed to depend on if they were a man or a woman. While men tended to have more muscle, the women tended to be a little chubby, though there were a few cases where it was swapped, and a few that were of more average weight. Actually, now that she thought about, the whole town seemed to be a little on the heavy side, even those girls.

Shaking that thought from her head, Leona returned her focus to what she would do if things in the bar went sour, and quickly decided that she could definitely take on everyone in the bar. But she soon realized that wouldn’t be necessary when anyone with a mug raised it, and everyone cheered, “Welcome strangers!”

Giving the pub area an awkward smile, Leona replied, “Um, hello…I’d like to talk to someone about staying here.”

“Oh, I can help you with that.” A short, chubby woman with brown hair and brown eyes said as she approached Leona with a warm smile. “Just follow me and I can get you and your friend here all settled in.” Leona just nodded and followed the other woman, happily leaving Jonk behind.

The woman led Leona into a small office with a desk and a few desks and not much else. The woman sat down in chair behind the desk and opened the large book that sat on it. “Okay, first I’m gonna need your name as well as the name of the ogre.“

“His name is Jonk and my name…is Leona.”

“Oh, that’s a very pretty name, Leona~” The woman cooed as she wrote their names down. “My name is Elizabeth, but you can call me Eliza, but you can call me whatever you want~”

Thankfully, Elizabeth didn’t seem to recognize her name, which meant she didn’t have to worry about having to sign autographs or get herself sketched with anyone. “I’ll just call you Eliza.”

“Alright,” She said with a defeated tone. “So, we have a few prices for staying here. The standard price is twenty silver coins for each night, and for an extra five a night you can have full use of the normal facilities like the spa or the hot springs. We can also get you a privet groom who’ll take care of your every need during your stay…” Eliza paused and leaned over her desk to whisper, “And I mean every need.”

Leona couldn’t help but blush at that. “Well, if I understand your use of “every need,” and I’m pretty sure I do, I wouldn’t want a groom, if you get my meaning. Not saying that I would even use her in that way…I just…you know…”

“Yeah, I do, more than you’d think. But don’t worry; I make sure that my town is a safe place for anyone and everyone. In case you didn’t notice the couples in the main area."

“Wait, do you mean-“

“Yup, this whole town belongs to me. Don’t bother asking me how I managed it though; I wouldn’t want any of my trade secrets getting out. Anyways, back to the prices. We also have something called Platinum Services, and incase you haven’t guessed it’s very expensive, a full five platinum coins a night! But it’s still the best deal, if you have the coin that is. You’ll stay in the nicest room, next to mine of course, you can have as much food as you want, you’ll have access the Platinum Facilities, and as many privet wenches as you like. But it’s not the best thing for a figure,” Elizabeth said as she leaned back and rested her hands on her chubby stomach. “Trust me, I live a Platinum life.”

“Hmm…alright, I’ve decided…”

“…I’ll just pay for the standard and go from there. Maybe check the town out some.” Elizabeth decides to become Leona’s tour guide while she’s in town.

“…That having access to the normal facilities will be enough. Not too sure about the wench though…” Elizabeth offers to be Leona’s privet wench to make sure she gets what she needs, without the sexual parts (for a while at least).

“…Platinum sounds perfect for what I want to experience. Besides, that extra weight doesn’t look too bad on you *blush*.” Love forms and grows between Leona and Elizabeth rather fast, but their stomachs do the same and just as fast.
